main event: Multiple sightings of an unidentified flying object over Lake Leelanau, Michigan, from March 26 to April 1, 1956.
interesting points: A witness playing golf observed an oval or disc-shaped object that changed color as it approached., The object was described as having bright light and being larger than a star., Witnesses reported seeing a bright light hovering and changing colors at night., The Air Force investigated with connections to weather balloons launched nearby., Some investigators concluded the sightings might have been astronomical phenomena, specifically identifying Venus as a possible explanation.
sighted object: oval or disc-shaped object changing colors and glowing brightly
witness description: Individuals of varying ages and occupations including students and a farmer, who reported sightings with sincerity.
